title: [BUG or not] Theta Forecaster | In-sample predictions intervals
body:
**Describe the bug**
Not sure if this is a bug or not, but in-sample predictions using a theta forecaster produce only a few point with prediction intervals. Also, it produces a warning about sqrt

**To Reproduce**
See [notebook here](https://gist.github.com/ngupta23/84f88421b74a69159259d0592740af4b)

```python
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/theta.py:242: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in sqrt
  self.fh.to_relative(self.cutoff) * self.initial_level_ ** 2 + 1

 Freq: M, Length: 144, dtype: float64,               lower       upper
 1949-01         NaN         NaN
 1949-02         NaN         NaN
 1949-03         NaN         NaN
 1949-04         NaN         NaN
 1949-05         NaN         NaN
 ...             ...         ...
 1960-08         NaN         NaN
 1960-09         NaN         NaN
 1960-10         NaN         NaN
 1960-11  460.988595  461.011407
 1960-12  325.257407  457.399779
```

**Expected behavior**
Should it have returned more values for prediction interval or are the NA values expected?


**Versions**
sktime=0.8.1
